nodes.bodyText: probably should have a documentation reference
not quite sure what you had in mind on this one.  a comment that points at our user's guide?  or you mean something that points to liberty's use of the TZ env var?
points to the use of the TZ env variable. I think a quick statement is probably worthwhile

unfortunately I didn't find anything about this in the openliberty docs.
https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEQTP_8.5.5/com.ibm.websphere.base.doc/ae/trun_svr_timezones.html is a reasonable link, but quite old.
https://www.gnu.org/software/libc/manual/html_node/TZ-Variable.html is pretty generic, but begs the question "does it work on windows?"
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2493749/how-to-set-a-jvm-timezone-properly is probably the most authoritative but the accepted answer recommends using the java property instead of the env var.
I do know it needs to be in the server.env file. We tried -D in the jvm options and that doesn't work.
